Sentencas: The degradation mechanism of micro-tubular Solid oxide fuel cells (mSOFC) has been studied as a function of the fuel utilization (FU from 40 to 80%) along the tube (inlet, center and outlet).
Titulo: Understanding longitudinal degradation mechanisms of large-area micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: La0.6Sr0.4-Co0.5Fe0.5O3/Sm0.2Ce0.8O2/8YSZ/Ni-YSZ pristine cells undergone to different galvanostatic tests were carefully characterized by Raman spectroscopy as well as scanning electron microscopy and energy dispersive X-ray spectroscopy analyses.
Titulo: Understanding longitudinal degradation mechanisms of large-area micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this work, remarkable cation diffusion through the barrier layer - electrolyte interface and Ni-reoxidation have been detected as main degradation mechanisms.
Titulo: Understanding longitudinal degradation mechanisms of large-area micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These phenomena, strongly enhanced by the high fuel utilization, promote Y-segregation through electrolyte and anode, enhancing the reduction of the Ni-percolation paths and, eventually, leading to the reduction of the barrier layer thickness.
Titulo: Understanding longitudinal degradation mechanisms of large-area micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The most significant microstructural modifications have been identified in the outlet part of the tube where especially harsh operating conditions, in terms of temperature, fuel utilization and polarization gradients, occur.
Titulo: Understanding longitudinal degradation mechanisms of large-area micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: An increase of the total gas flow has shown beneficial effects on the described phenomena reducing the effects of the degradation.
Titulo: Understanding longitudinal degradation mechanisms of large-area micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Increasing the carrier gas flow allows lower degradation rates for cells operating under high fuel utilization up to 80% for 1000 h. (c) 2018
Titulo: Understanding longitudinal degradation mechanisms of large-area micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cells
